verses.roman:
viśa viśa śākhā kari' eka eka maṇḍala
mahā-mahā-śākhā chāila brahmāṇḍa sakala

synonyms: viśa viśa—twenty, twenty; śākhā—branches; kari'-making a group; eka eka maṇḍala—form a society; mahā-mahā-śākhā—big branches; chāila—covered; brahmāṇḍa—the whole universe; sakala—all.
translation: Thus the branches of the Caitanya tree formed a cluster or society, with great branches covering all the universe.

purport.content: Our International Society for Krishna Consciousness is one of the branches of the Caitanya tree.
